1499196163865645059.text: Thank you to everyone who joined our tele-town hall tonight! We had nearly 6,000 people tune in. I appreciate all of those who asked questions and listened online. As always, I enjoy representing the great people of #NE02.

1499194582831144965.text:
Q: GI Benefits Bill
A: There is a disparity between how the Guard and Reserves are treated. There has been pushback, but I sided with our guards and reserves on this issue. I value their service & what they do for the US. There needs to be parity when it comes to these benefits.

1499193496099594242.text:
Q: What will get our country back on track? (pt2)
A: The Biden Admin talks very little about trade. We need to fight to open trade doors back up and fight for our farmers and ag producers. We also need to maintain the tax code that helps us compete with other countries.

1499193376071163906.text:
Q: What will get our country back on track?
A: Inflation is the #1 issue. We have to get spending under control. Before COVID, our pay was increasing faster than inflation. We also need to look at increasing jobs in the trades. These are outstanding jobs.

1499192102000992256.text:
Q: Securing Elections
A: The Constitution protects state’s election laws. I voted against H.R. 1 which would federally fund congressional campaigns and cost the taxpayer billions of dollars. I believe Nebraska’s elections were accurate, but we can always push for more security.

1499189416031571971.text:
Q: Climate Solutions
A: No matter your views, we want to leave a better world for the next generation. I supported the wind/solar tax credits. Carbon capture technologies and battery storage are vital to improving our environment. Energy independence is top priority.

1499188578324201472.text:
Q: Medicare
A: I agree that we should be able to negotiate these prices. It takes too long to get generic drugs on the market. We have the best research for pharmaceutical research…however Americans pay for this. We need to do better with this and help more people.

1499186870466531331.text:
Q: Inflation
A: Last March, we passed the $1.9T COVID bill. We were warned that it would trigger inflation. We added about 10% to the money supply with no way to pay it. Larry Summers also warned us about BBB. Congress has to REIGN IN spending & stop the massive deficit spending.

1499185828475641857.text:
Q: Ukraine
A: Bullies don’t stop unless they get scared. We need to continue helping Ukraine and giving them the tools they need to fight, but I've been impressed with their pride and bravery. For decades they’ve been fighting and preserving their freedom and independence.

1499185160415236097.text:
Q: Afghanistan (pt3)
A: The President also failed to address this last night. This was NOT a success. This was a strategic failure.

1499184912926220289.text:
Q: Afghanistan (pt2)
A: The President called this a “success” and he had no regrets. We lost 13 servicemen. Thousands of lives lost and interpreters are still being hunted down. They were owed better by this. Our adversaries are emboldened. Putin& Xi are watching.

1499184582301786117.text:
Q: Afghanistan
A: I deployed four times to the Middle East. This is personal to me. […] We’ve been providing a ton of air power to Afghanistan. We trained Afghan pilots and they were doing a good job. But the withdraw moved our pilots/mechanics.

1499182834191380485.text:
Q: Energy Independence
A: Many bases in Europe use Russian gas. If you remove their energy, these bases will struggle. We should not be dependent on them. […] POTUS’ EO cancelling the Keystone XL Pipeline cost thousands of US jobs & increased the safety risk of transporting fuel

1499180953272344585.text:
Q: Renaming Bases
A: We have 10 bases named after confederate generals..some affiliated w/ the KKK. I don’t think it’s appropriate. I suggested renaming a base after Fort Benavidez, a soldier who was wounded 31 times while rescuing 8 fellow soldiers. He is a TRUE American hero.

1499178944167350284.text:
Q: Infrastructure
A: Nebraska will receive about $2.5B to maintain and repair roads and highways...including $216M for two programs that provide low-interest loans for building or improving water & wastewater systems. It was also based on per-capita.

This bill is good for #NE02, Nebraska, and the US, making us stronger and more competitive for years to come. https://t.co/N3s2TEkRfl

1468762149099028481.text: Rep. Bacon: My goal is to do what's best for my district and our state. If we go neutral, our values and economy will be threatened by other countries.

1468761544108478468.text: Mike McDonnell, President of Omaha Federation of Labor: We simply have to have this infrastructure to compete.

1468760859631669252.text: Rep. Bacon: Majority of the infrastructure bill is paid for by unspent COVID money that was already appropriated by Congress. The remaining $550B is new spending.

1468759970963460098.text: Mark McHargue (NE Farm Bureau): Expanding broadband capabilities will help our smaller family farms get their business out there and help them market better.

1468759409740460033.text: Rep. Bacon: About 94% of this bill is hard infrastructure. It was not perfect, but infrastructure is in a different category when it comes to spending. I thought this was worth the expense. We've been talking about infrastructure for decades.

1468757843205664774.text: Rep. Bacon: About $358M is going to water infrastructure in NE. This issue is big for Douglas and Sarpy County.

1468753493204865025.text: My @ProbSolveCaucus colleagues and I drafted the bipartisan infrastructure bill [...] We got the Senate on board. Overtime it got politicized which is unfortunate. This was built from the ground up..this was our effort. This wasn't the President's or Pelosi's bill.

1468752199622840321.text: Rep. Bacon: BIF invests in our electrical grid. We know the Chinese gov and Russia want to interfere in our cyber and defense capabilities. $12.7M will go to NE to help our energy and cyber grid so that we're more protected against our adversaries.

1468751422871195654.text: Rep. Bacon: My goal is to get us back to normal and get our workforce back to how it used to be before COVID.

1468751175331758081.text: Rep. Bacon: In Nebraska we're going to get $200M to replace our lead water pipes. [...] Workforce is a top issue in NE..10% of our workforce is missing. We need to start talking to our young folks and get them interested in the trades. These are good paying jobs!

1468750479039549442.text: Rep. Bacon: We want to have safe transportation. [...] It only took us 1 year to build the Pentagon. Currently it takes 6-7 years just to get a permit to build bridges and major buildings..it shouldn't take that long...We can do better.

1468748745181437954.text: Felicia Hilton (Regional Political Dir.-Carpenter’s Union): Having access to broadband will also help us reach younger people and get them involved in the trades.

1468748410635313156.text: Felicia Hilton (Regional Political Dir.-Carpenter’s Union): There’s a # of apprentices that will finish their programs faster because of BIF. This also pushes for energy independence. We’re excited to repair our water infrastructure and transmission lines for our energy sector.

1468747271479177224.text: Mike McDonnell, President of Omaha Federation of Labor: This infrastructure bill should've been done 40 years ago [...] For starters, $45M will go to existing programs and $55M will go to new formula programs, including transportation and bridges.

1468745926873387011.text: Dr. Ernie Goss, Economics Prof Creighton University: Rural broadband access is very important [...] One of the biggest issues is supply chain disruptions. BIF will fix those problems [...] Manufacturing & Ag is instrumental to our state and BIF will help us economically.

1468744623224938498.text: Mark McHargue (NE Farm Bureau): BIF provides livestock exemptions & allows us to travel further to unload our livestock. Livestock can’t sit alongside a road in a blizzard. There has also been cyber attacks on our ag industry. This will impact NE more than any other state.

1468743780849397760.text: Bryan Slone (NE Chamber): This bill brings billions of $$ to our state for broadband access [...] $186M will also go to public transportation. Millions will also go to our airports. We want to attract people to Nebraska.

1468743660493844486.text: Bryan Slone (NE Chamber): 1/10 jobs is tied to manufacturing [...] Majority of our economy relies on infrastructure.

1468742322879967232.text: 80-90% of the criticisms are from people who think this was the Build Back Better bill. The infrastructure bill is NOT BBB...and I voted against BBB.

1468741828363145217.text: This bill will fix our highways, seaports, and locks, and will provide more access to rural broadband. This will also fix many of the toxic spills on our lands.

1468741565308936200.text: Rep. Bacon: We spend about 2% of our GDP on infrastructure...[...] I've been working with the Problem Solvers over the last year on this infrastructure bill.
